lobstr 1.1.1.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Display tree of references

Source: R/ref.R
ref.Rd

This tree display focusses on the distinction between names and values. For each reference-type object (lists, environments, and optional character vectors), it displays the location of each component. The display shows the connection between shared references using a locally unique id.

ref(..., character = FALSE)

Arguments

...

One or more objects
character

If TRUE, show references from character vector in to global string pool

See also

Other object inspectors: ast(), sxp()

Examples

x <- 1:100
ref(x)

#> [1:0x7ff41f3dda20] <int> 

y <- list(x, x, x)
ref(y)

#> █ [1:0x7ff420aa37b8] <list> 
#> ├─[2:0x7ff41f3dda20] <int> 
#> ├─[2:0x7ff41f3dda20] 
#> └─[2:0x7ff41f3dda20] 
ref(x, y)

#> [1:0x7ff41f3dda20] <int> 
#>  
#> █ [2:0x7ff420aa37b8] <list> 
#> ├─[1:0x7ff41f3dda20] 
#> ├─[1:0x7ff41f3dda20] 
#> └─[1:0x7ff41f3dda20] 

e <- new.env()
e$e <- e
e$x <- x
e$y <- list(x, e)
ref(e)

#> █ [1:0x7ff41d48dae8] <env> 
#> ├─x = [2:0x7ff41f3dda20] <int> 
#> ├─y = █ [3:0x7ff41f0c31c8] <list> 
#> │     ├─[2:0x7ff41f3dda20] 
#> │     └─[1:0x7ff41d48dae8] 
#> └─e = [1:0x7ff41d48dae8] 

# Can also show references to global string pool if requested
ref(c("x", "x", "y"))

#> [1:0x7ff41ed7b848] <chr> 
ref(c("x", "x", "y"), character = TRUE)

#> █ [1:0x7ff41ed7ce78] <chr> 
#> ├─[2:0x7ff419851238] <string: "x"> 
#> ├─[2:0x7ff419851238] 
#> └─[3:0x7ff41992dc30] <string: "y">
